body.p: A Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician. Educated at Georgetown College and graduated from the law department of Transylvania University in 1846. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Georgetown, Kentucky and Chicago, Illinois. Recruited and served as a regimental adjutant and brigade adjutant with the Third Kentucky Volunteers in the Mexican War. Married to Emily Mary Sanders Bradley. Father of Anna Bradley, Mathew S. Bradley, Victor F. Bradley, Betty Sanders Bradley, and John Bradley. Moved to Chicago to practice law and work as a land agent from 1854 to 1861. Served as a major in the First Battalion of Kentucky Mounted Rifleman of the Confederate States of America from 1861 to 1864. Served the Eleventh Congressional District as a member of the Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1864 to 1865.
